moves.1. e4: Game note: “I'm 4-1 vs him. My loss was black. He plays uncommon openings. Can't remember what he does vs Sicilian. Let's see...”
moves.1... c5 2. Bc4: Game note: “just remember somebody else played this opening and I went dragon which may not have been ideal”
moves.2... d6 3. d3: In hindsight I noticed this pins-in his LSB.
moves.3... Nf6 4. h3 e6 5. Nf3 Be7 6. g4 Nc6 7: Game note: “8.Be3 I think Nc3 would have been better because now I have ...d5”  Post analysis shows a clear -0.82 with 8…Qb6 and yes …d5 is also a good option.
moves.8... d5 9. e5 Qc7: I immediately noticed my woops??  9…Nxe5 10.Nxe5 Qa5+ 11.Nd2 Qxb5 would have been great or just the simple …Nd7.
moves.10. exf6 gxf6: Game note: “10...gxf6 is ugly but not sure about ...Bxf6”.  I still wasn’t seeing …Qa5+ was I?
Game note: “12.Kd2 and 14.Qe2 not a clue what he's doing so I'm moving in to snatch his LSB. Around move 18 or so I may need to move my c-pawn out of the way to allow my Q to slide back to the K-side.”  He wasted a big material advantage.
Computer didn’t see this move.  It was looking for an immediate Q retreat to d8 or some resolution of the k-side pawns with 18…fxg5.  Once it analyzes the text move it comes to the same conclusion.  Weird.
moves.19. gxf6 Qf5 20. Rag1+ Kh8 21. Rg3: Game note: “21.Rg3 now I have a few options ...cxd3 ...Qxf6 ...Rf8 ...Rb8 and watch for ...Rd8 if that file opens up. He's got the option to double his R's. I'm only at -1 material so could be worse. Allowing his Q to e3-h6-g7 would be catastrophic.”  By the way 21.Qe5 would have been better, removing one of the only defenders of my K-side.
moves.21... cxd3 22. cxd3 Qxf6 23. Qe5: Game note: “23.Qe5 so he wants a Q trade. I think it’s too late because I still wanna play ...Rb8 but if Nxc6 then ...Bb7 pins his N to his R on h1. Having said that, his e5 N is dangerous on account of Nxf7+ so I'll kick that away first with 26...f6.”
Game note: “28...??? ...Rb8 getting tougher to play. Now thinking ...Bh1 (better central control), ...Rf7, or ...f5 first.”
moves.33... Bxh3 34. f4 Bf5 35. Rd6 h5 36. Rd5: Game note: “36.Rd5 but advancing his centre pawns needs to be his main tactic.”
moves.36... Kg6 37. d4 h4: Game note: “37...Rh4 = 3 steps to becoming a Q”
moves.40. Rxf5 Kxf5 41. c6 Re3+ 42. Kf2 Kxf4: I have a big advantage now.
moves.43. d5 Rc3 44. Kg1 Kg3 45. Kf1 h2 46. d6: Time to set a mating net.
